alert.note: Alert for Howard (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 02 at 9:15PM CDT until August 03 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Moniteau Creek near Fayette affecting Howard County. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Moniteau Creek near Fayette. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Low-lying fields along Moniteau Creek flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 16.9 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri 10pm 10pm 10pm Moniteau Creek Fayette 16.0 12.6 Wed 8pm 12.0 7.7 5.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
